message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.EC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with game theory and mechanism design, which are central topics in computer science. The focus is on analyzing the robust price of anarchy of altruistic games, which falls under the category of algorithmic game theory (cs.GT). The paper also introduces a new class of games, called social contribution games, which can be seen as a variant of congestion games, a well-studied topic in computer science (cs.DS). The paper uses techniques from optimization and approximation algorithms, which are relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the impact of social networks on the efficiency of altruistic games, which falls under the category of social computing (cs.SI). Overall, the paper covers a broad range of topics in computer science, but the focus on game theory and mechanism design suggests that cs.GT is the most likely sub-category.
